abstract: While immigrants constitute just over a third of the city's population, they own about 48 percent of the city's small businesses, according to a study published by the Fiscal Policy Institute.
snippet: While immigrants constitute just over a third of the city's population, they own about 48 percent of the city's small businesses, according to a study published by the Fiscal Policy Institute.
lead_paragraph: Any taxi-riding, bodega-shopping, laundromat-using New Yorker knows that immigrants own many of the businesses that make New York tick. Now a new study shows that while immigrants constitute just over a third of the city's population, they make up nearly half of the city's small-business owners.

headline.main: Immigrants Play Key Role as City Entrepreneurs, Study Finds
